content:
Hello there We have read that message. We try to help.

Some of the reminders are not visible.

It might be time to check for some settings : Enable reminders Set reminders. Show missed reminders. Check for updates for that calendar . Be shure thane that calendar settings are not hidden. Having calendar extensions?check for their updates.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Hello there


Other fix for that reminders ainâ€™t there.

Got o view > calendar>Calendar pane>Calendar list>Activate it.

If that calendar is locked right click on that calendar select properties then uncheck the read only box that appears there. It might be solved now.

Be sure that there are no other calendars. Delete them if possible.



Greetings google Thunderbird.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content: For the performance issue, does it help to remove the status bar from View > Toolbars?
creator: wsmwk

content:
1. Press the Alt key, then click View > Toolbars > Menu Bar.

2. The panel below the list of email files will show the email you select from the list above. If you don't want that, pressing F8 will get rid of that panel.
creator: siffemoz

content: Thanks Ed. I have retrieved the Menu Bar which enables me to perform tasks as previously. The 'New Message' panel for initiating a new email is still missing , but as per my earlier email, I can still compose and send emails. Your help is much appreciated. Regards, David
creator: terjesen

content:
terjesen said
The 'New Message' panel for initiating a new email is still missing...

Try TB menu bar > View > Folders > Folder Pane Header.
creator: siffemoz

content: All good Ed with 'New Message' panel retrieved. Thanks once again. Regards, David
creator: terjesen

content:
The following methods might be helpful:

Method A: (On the Message List Pane) click on the email > (In menu bar) "View" > "Message Source" (Ctrl + U).

Method B: (On the Message Pane) "More" > "View Source".
creator: Yu5tiqX9og
